FuncDef:
The ds-lite load-balance hash-arithmetic command configures the hash algorithm used to implement CGN ECMP and trunk load balancing.
The undo ds-lite load-balance hash-arithmetic command restores the default hash algorithm used to implement CGN ECMP and trunk load balancing.
By default, the CRC64 algorithm using polynomial 0x1EDC6F41 is used to implement CGN ECMP and trunk load balancing.
CLIs: ds-lite load-balance hash-arithmetic { hash-arithmetic1 | hash-arithmetic2 | hash-arithmetic3 }
undo ds-lite load-balance hash-arithmetic { hash-arithmetic2 | hash-arithmetic3 }

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the CRC64 algorithm using polynomial 0x1EDC6F41.
-

Indicates the CRC64 algorithm using polynomial 0x04C11DB7.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The hash algorithm produces results, which differs with network traffic models. An appropriate hash algorithm can be selected based on the network traffic model. To configure a hash algorithm used to implement CGN ECMP and trunk load balancing, run the ds-lite load-balance hash-arithmetic command. This command helps implement the best load balancing.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
